questiontext.text: In a sample of girls, we found that they lost weight after 15 months (\(M = âˆ’3.1\) kg). Using a statistical test, this difference in average weight is significant. What kind of statistical error may have occurred?

generalfeedback.text: It is an error of the first kind: \(H_0\) has been rejected, but there is really no difference at all.

answer.text: An error of the first kind: \(H_0\) has been rejected, but there is actually no difference at all.
An error of the second kind: \(H_0\) is not rejected, but there is a difference.

feedback.text: It is concluded that the difference is significant. Being \(H_0\) then rejected or not rejected?

answer.text: An error of the first kind: \(H_1\) is assumed, but in real life the difference is much greater.
An error of the first and second kind can both: in statistical tests, you simply take the chance of making an error.
